project.name: Superhumans Directory
project.description: A transparent, data-driven directory of the most impactful people in longevity, aging research, biohacking, and wellness. The world's most comprehensive and transparent directory of longevity experts, powered by data and driven by a vision of a healthier, longer-living humanity.

brandFoundations.brandDescription: Building the world's most comprehensive and transparent directory of longevity experts, powered by data and driven by a vision of a healthier, longer-living humanity. Superhumans is a Nordic product built with the most sophisticated expert discovery and ranking system in longevity science.
brandFoundations.mission: To democratize access to information about the world's leading longevity experts, making cutting-edge aging research and innovation transparent and accessible to everyone.
brandFoundations.vision: A world where breakthrough discoveries in longevity science reach those who can benefit most, accelerating the path to healthier, longer lives for all humanity.
brandFoundations.problemStatement: Longevity research and expert information is not accessible to everyone. Cutting-edge aging research and innovation lacks transparency and accessibility. Students, researchers, journalists, and the public face barriers in discovering and connecting with leading experts.
brandFoundations.solutionStatement: A free, comprehensive directory that aggregates data from research publications, podcasts, patents, policy documents, and industry sources to create detailed expert profiles with verified credentials, using transparent, multi-dimensional scoring.
brandFoundations.brandEthos: Community-first philosophy where longevity research should be accessible to everyone without barriers. Every ranking is backed by verifiable data with openly published methodology.
brandFoundations.brandPromise: Transparent, reproducible expert rankings backed by verified data sources, updated daily with real-time discovery system

targetAudience.name: Researchers and Academics
targetAudience.role: Longevity researchers, university professors, postdoctoral researchers, graduate students
targetAudience.techComfort: High - comfortable with scientific databases and academic tools
targetAudience.psychographics: Scientifically rigorous, evidence-based decision makers, value peer-reviewed research and citations
goals: Discover leading experts in longevity science
painPoints: Lack of transparency in expert rankings
No unified view of expert credentials and impact
targetAudience.geography: Global - with emphasis on North America, Europe, Nordic countries, Asia
jobsToBeDone: Discover latest publications in longevity science

targetAudience.name: Journalists and Media Professionals
targetAudience.role: Science journalists, health writers, media producers
targetAudience.psychographics: Story-driven, seek credible sources, value accessibility and clarity
goals: Find credible expert sources for articles
behaviours: Track trending topics in health and longevity
jobsToBeDone: Discover trending topics and emerging experts

targetAudience.name: General Public and Longevity Enthusiasts
targetAudience.role: General public interested in longevity, biohacking, and wellness
targetAudience.techComfort: Medium - comfortable with web applications and directories
targetAudience.psychographics: Health-conscious, proactive about longevity, interested in cutting-edge science, value accessibility
painPoints: No clear rankings of expert credibility
behaviours: Read books on biohacking and wellness
targetAudience.geography: Global - particularly North America, Europe, Nordic countries

targetAudience.name: Investors and Business Professionals
targetAudience.segment: Venture capital, healthcare investors, business development
targetAudience.psychographics: Data-driven, seek innovation opportunities, value metrics and track records
painPoints: Scattered information about patents and funding
No unified view of expert commercial impact
targetAudience.geography: Global - with focus on innovation hubs
jobsToBeDone: Access comprehensive expert data via API

positioningAndMessaging.tagline: Discover the World's Top Longevity Experts
positioningAndMessaging.positioningStatement: The world's most comprehensive and transparent directory of longevity experts, built on transparent, data-driven rankings with real-time updates
positioningAndMessaging.elevatorPitch: A transparent, data-driven directory of the most impactful people in longevity, aging research, biohacking, and wellness. Updated daily with the most sophisticated expert discovery and ranking system in longevity science.
messagingPillars: Comprehensive Data Collection - aggregates data from research publications, podcasts, patents, policy documents, and industry sources
Multi-Dimensional Scoring - transparent scoring system evaluates experts across research output, public reach, innovation, and policy impact
Real-Time Updates - automated discovery system continuously monitors new publications, appearances, and achievements
Quality & Verification - every source is verified and weighted based on credibility with strict quality standards
narrativeFragments: Students, researchers, journalists, and the public can discover and connect with leading experts without barriers
Every ranking is backed by verifiable data with openly published methodology
Nordic product with emphasis on Nordic representation (20% target)

competitiveAnalysis.marketCategory: Expert directory, longevity research database, scientific expert ranking platform
competitiveAnalysis.positioningSummary: First comprehensive, transparent, data-driven directory specifically focused on longevity experts with automated discovery and multi-dimensional scoring

keyOpportunities: First mover in comprehensive longevity expert directory
uniqueSellingPoints: Daily automated updates from multiple data sources
Free public access with premium API features
Open methodology and verifiable data sources
differentiationStrategy.whiteSpaceInsights: No existing comprehensive directory combines research publications, podcast appearances, patents, and policy influence with transparent scoring for longevity experts
blueOceanIndicators: First comprehensive longevity expert directory with automated discovery
Free access model in premium data space

websiteGoals: Provide free access to comprehensive longevity expert directory
Enable expert discovery through search and filters
Display transparent rankings with verifiable sources
Facilitate expert discovery for multiple user segments
Offer API access for developers and researchers
webAndContentNotes.contentStrategyNotes: Content emphasizes transparency, scientific rigor, and accessibility. Data-driven approach with verifiable sources. Educational content about methodology. Community-first messaging. Nordic market positioning.

problemDefinition.context: The longevity and aging research field is rapidly growing with numerous experts, researchers, podcasters, and innovators. However, information about these experts is scattered across multiple platforms, lacks transparency in credibility assessment, and is often inaccessible to general audiences who would benefit from this knowledge.
problemDefinition.primaryProblem: There is no comprehensive, transparent, and accessible directory of longevity experts that combines research credentials, public reach, innovation impact, and policy influence into a unified, data-driven ranking system.
secondaryProblems: Students, researchers, and journalists struggle to identify credible expert sources
Expert rankings and credibility assessments are opaque and non-verifiable
Information is scattered across academic databases, podcasts, books, patents, and policy documents
No real-time updates on expert activities and contributions
Limited geographic diversity in expert visibility
Nordic experts underrepresented in global longevity discussions
problemDefinition.businessImpact: Target 10K monthly active users by Q2 2025, 1,000 expert profiles by Q3 2025, 100 API users by Q4 2025
userPainPoints: Cannot easily verify expert credentials and impact
No unified view of expert contributions across multiple domains
Difficulty discovering emerging voices in longevity
Lack of transparency in expert ranking methodologies
Barriers to accessing expert information (paywalls, scattered sources)
hypotheses: Users value transparency in expert rankings and want to see the methodology
Multi-dimensional scoring (research, reach, innovation, policy) provides more holistic expert assessment than single metrics
Real-time automated updates provide more value than static annual rankings
Free access model will drive higher adoption than premium-only model
Geographic diversity including Nordic representation addresses underserved market
constraints: API rate limits for data sources (PubMed, Crossref, Listen Notes)
Twitter API costs $100+/month for social media metrics
Manual curation required for quality control
Database query performance with large datasets
Row Level Security implementation needed for public access
Budget constraints for premium API services

solutionOverview.valueProposition: A transparent, data-driven directory of the most impactful people in longevity, aging research, biohacking, and wellness, updated daily with verified sources and reproducible rankings.
keyFeatures: Comprehensive expert directory with 500+ tracked experts
Multi-dimensional scoring system (Research 40%, Public Reach 30%, Innovation 20%, Policy 10%)
Real-time automated discovery from PubMed, Crossref, Listen Notes, patents
Advanced search and filtering by score, specialty, region, source type
Detailed expert profiles with verified sources
Analytics dashboard with diversity and geographic statistics
Geographic diversity tracking with Nordic emphasis
differentiators: Only comprehensive longevity expert directory with transparent methodology
Geographic diversity with Nordic market focus
Verifiable data sources shown for each expert
Open methodology that users can validate
outOfScopeForNow: User accounts and authentication (planned for post-launch)
Social media metrics from Twitter/X (requires $100+/month API)
Expert verification system and badges (planned for future)
Community voting and feedback (planned for future)
nonFunctionalRequirements: Database query optimization for large datasets
Row Level Security for public data access
API rate limiting (10,000 requests/day, 50 req/sec burst)
Responsive design for mobile and desktop

earlyAdopterProfile.description: Longevity enthusiasts, biohackers, science journalists, and graduate students actively researching aging and longevity topics
earlyAdopterProfile.teamSizeRange: Individual users or small research teams (1-10 people)

idealCustomerProfile.description: Academic institutions, research organizations, media companies, and healthcare organizations needing comprehensive longevity expert data
regions: Nordic Countries (Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Finland, Iceland)
Asia (Japan, Singapore, South Korea, China, India)
idealCustomerProfile.budgetRange: API users willing to pay for premium access and higher rate limits
idealCustomerProfile.maturityLevel: Organizations with established research or media operations needing reliable expert data

leanCanvas.uniqueValueProposition: The world's most comprehensive and transparent directory of longevity experts with automated daily updates and verifiable data-driven rankings
leanCanvas.unfairAdvantage: Proprietary automated discovery system, established data sources and partnerships, transparent methodology, Nordic market position, first-mover advantage in longevity expert directory space
leanCanvas.highLevelConcept: Google Scholar meets LinkedIn for longevity experts

aiMetadata.creationPrompt: Analyze this codebase and extract all project information into structured JSON format for PRD documentation
aiMetadata.sourceCodeType: Full-stack application: React/TypeScript frontend, Supabase PostgreSQL backend, Edge Functions for automation
aiMetadata.extractionSummary: Successfully extracted comprehensive information from Superhumans Directory codebase including brand foundations, mission/vision, technical architecture, data model, user flows, scoring methodology, discovery system, and target audience. Project is a longevity expert directory with automated discovery and transparent ranking system.

mediumConfidence: User pain points (inferred from problem statements)
lowConfidence: Specific KPI targets beyond what's mentioned
notAvailable: Client name (appears to be internal product)

fromTier3: Client organization name (may be internal product)
Exact demographic data for target audiences
potentialSources: Stakeholder interviews with Ash Pournouri, Faris Zacina, Resad Zacina
missingInformation.recommendation: The codebase provides excellent technical and product information. To complete a full PRD, consider gathering: (1) formal brand guidelines with color/typography specifications, (2) detailed competitor analysis, (3) financial projections and business model details, (4) formal user research data and personas, (5) detailed roadmap with dates. The current extraction provides a strong foundation for a technical PRD.

assumptions: Target audience segments inferred from mission statements and features
User pain points derived from problem context in About page
Jobs to be done inferred from feature descriptions
Early adopter profile based on content positioning
Revenue streams marked as 'planned' based on admin dashboard notes
Geographic targeting based on discovery system priorities
User journey phases constructed from available features and flows
aiMetadata.extractionNotes: This is a well-documented codebase with clear mission, methodology, and technical architecture. The project has strong transparency focus with openly published methodology. Nordic market emphasis is notable. Some business model details are marked as 'planned' indicating early stage. Technical implementation is production-ready with Supabase backend, automated discovery via Edge Functions, and comprehensive frontend. Team from Ministry of Programming with strong credentials. Missing typical client brief elements suggest this is an internal product rather than client work.
